unnormalised: Someone asked where the Income Tax office is in Bangalore? Bhai, let me tell you, finding a govt. address is like finding a needle in a haystack, especially in a city like Bangalore with its crazy traffic and one-way streets! You could literally spend 2 hrs circling around if you're relying solely on Google Maps. They tell you "near MG Road" but MG Road is like 10 km long!
normalised: Someone asked where the Income Tax office is in Bangalore? Bhai, let me tell you, finding a government address is like finding a needle in a haystack, especially in a city like Bangalore with its crazy traffic and one way streets! You could literally spend two hours circling around if you are relying solely on G-o-o-g-l-e Maps. They tell you "near M-G Road" but M-G Road is like ten kilometer long!

unnormalised: Seriously though, the main Income Tax office, Aayakar Bhavan, is pretty famous. It's at No. 72, KR Road. But, like every address in India, it’s more complicated than that. Try telling your auto-rickshaw driver "No. 72, KR Road" and watch the confusion dawn on his face. You’ll have to add “near the old Canara Bank” or “opposite that huge banyan tree” for any hope of reaching your destination before 5 PM.
normalised: Seriously though, the main Income Tax office, Aayakar Bhavan, is pretty famous. It is at number seventy two, K-R Road. But, like every address in India, it is more complicated than that. Try telling your auto-rickshaw driver "number seventy two, K-R Road" and watch the confusion dawn on his face. You will have to add “near the old Canara Bank” or “opposite that huge banyan tree” for any hope of reaching your destination before five P-M.

unnormalised: So, good luck navigating the address jungle! And remember to factor in an extra 30 mins for “Indian Standard Time” delays. If you're still lost, just ask someone, but be warned, you might get 5 different answers, all equally confident and equally wrong! The only thing more complicated than Indian addresses is Indian politics.
normalised: So, good luck navigating the address jungle! And remember to factor in an extra thirty minutes for “Indian Standard Time” delays. If you are still lost, just ask someone, but be warned, you might get five different answers, all equally confident and equally wrong!
